transcript.title: Australians facing the death penalty in Indonesia
transcript.content:
Australia opposes the death penalty at home and abroad.

While Australia respects Indonesiaâs sovereignty, we are asking that Indonesia reconsider its decision to execute two Australian citizens. Â 

The government has made representations at the highest levels.Â 

The Foreign Affairs Minister and I have both made representations to our Indonesian counterparts and are continuing to make every possible effort through the most effective channels to stop Mr Sukumaran and Mr Chan being executed.

The Opposition has been fully briefed on our efforts and I thank them for their cooperation. This is appropriate as it is a matter that has spanned five governments.

This is an unimaginably difficult time for the families of these young men. I spoke with both families today and will ensure that the government continues to support them.

Both men are reformed characters and both have helped to rehabilitate other prisoners.

The prerogative of mercy should be extended to them.

In the best interests of Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan, the government will not make further public comments but I want to assure Australians that our support will continue.

23 January 2015
